Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerated as there is no evidence on the U.S. Steel website to support the announcement of six new mills.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the existence of six new mills.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the announcement made by President Trump is accurate, without providing concrete evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: Other American steelmakers have announced new mills and re-openings, suggesting that the claim may not be exclusive to U.S. Steel.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that U.S. Steel CEO David Burritt did not address the existence of six new mills in a conference call with investors.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it mentions contradictory statements made by President Trump regarding the number of mills U.S. Steel is building.
Understate: The claim may be understating the actual number of new mills being built by U.S. Steel, as it only mentions six while alternative explanations suggest more.
